intro: Pamea guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan pamea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It often grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
